card.name: Accorder Paladin
card.ability: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
card.flavor: "I fight for the suns, the surface, and everything in between."

card.name: Ardent Recruit
card.ability: Metalcraft — Ardent Recruit gets +2/+2 as long as you control three or more artifacts.
card.flavor: "We lost our homes and our kin. We won't let those rotters take our future as well."

card.name: Banishment Decree
card.ability: Put target artifact, creature, or enchantment on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor:
"Unworthy of consecration."
—Axsh, lesser cenobite

card.name: Black Sun's Zenith
card.ability: Put X -1/-1 counters on each creature. Shuffle Black Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
card.flavor:
"Under the suns, Mirrodin kneels and begs us for perfection."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If this spell is countered, none of its effects occur. In particular, it will go to the graveyard rather than to its owner's library.

card.name: Bladed Sentinel
card.ability: {W}: Bladed Sentinel gains vigilance until end of turn.
card.flavor: The Mirran partisans created hundreds of patrol sentinels to divert Phyrexian assaults from the Tangle.

card.name: Blightsteel Colossus
card.ability:
Trample, infect
Blightsteel Colossus is indestructible.
If Blightsteel Colossus would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Blightsteel Colossus and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : Lethal damage and effects that say "destroy" won't cause an indestructible creature to be put into the graveyard. However, an indestructible creature can be put into the graveyard for a number of reasons. The most likely reasons are if it's sacrificed or if its toughness is 0 or less. (In these cases, of course, Blightsteel Colossus would be shuffled into its owner's library instead of being put into its owner's graveyard.)

card.name: Blightwidow
card.ability:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

card.name: Blisterstick Shaman
card.ability: When Blisterstick Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: A productive warren requires a good deal of prodding.

card.name: Blue Sun's Zenith
card.ability: Target player draws X cards. Shuffle Blue Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
card.flavor:
"The Origin Query will wait. We must ensure we survive to return to it."
—Pelyus, vedalken ordinar
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : If this spell is countered, none of its effects occur. In particular, it will go to the graveyard rather than to its owner's library.
6/1/2011 : You follow the instructions in order. You won't be able to draw the same Blue Sun's Zenith that you cast.

card.name: Bonehoard
card.ability:
Living weapon (When this Equipment enters the battlefield, put a 0/0 black Germ creature token onto the battlefield, then attach this to it.)
Equipped creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
Equip {2}
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : The value of X is calculated continuously as the number of creature cards in graveyards changes.
6/1/2011 : If there are no creature cards in any graveyard when Bonehoard's living weapon ability resolves, the Germ will be 0/0 and put into its owner's graveyard.
6/1/2011 : Although creature tokens go to the graveyard before ceasing to exist, they never count as creature cards and won't increase the bonus granted by Bonehoard, however briefly.
6/1/2011 : If lethal damage is dealt simultaneously to the equipped creature and another creature, both creatures are put into the graveyard at the same time. The equipped creature won't get an additional bonus from the other creature.

card.name: Brass Squire
card.ability: {T}: Attach target Equipment you control to target creature you control.
card.flavor:
"I admire it. Few pull off pluck and subservience at the same time."
—Ezuri, renegade leader
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : If one of the targets is illegal when the activated ability resolves, nothing will happen and the Equipment won't move. Notably, if an opponent gains control of either target in response, the Equipment won't move.
6/1/2011 : Unlike the equip ability, Brass Squire's ability can be activated whenever you could cast an instant.

card.name: Burn the Impure
card.ability: Burn the Impure deals 3 damage to target creature. If that creature has infect, Burn the Impure deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.
card.flavor: Flame doesn't kneel to Phyrexia.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If the creature is an illegal target when Burn the Impure resolves, the spell will be countered and none of its effects will happen, even if that creature has infect.

card.name: Caustic Hound
card.ability: When Caustic Hound dies, each player loses 4 life.
card.flavor: At first, the Mirrans aimed for its exposed gut. The survivors quickly learned to do otherwise.

card.name: Choking Fumes
card.ability: Put a -1/-1 counter on each attacking creature.
card.flavor:
"Fall to your knees and welcome our embrace."
—Qal-Sha, Priest of Norn

card.name: Concussive Bolt
card.ability:
Concussive Bolt deals 4 damage to target player.
Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, creatures that player controls can't block this turn.
card.flavor: Shock one, awe the rest.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : The number of artifacts you control is checked only once: when Concussive Bolt resolves. If you don't control three or more artifacts at that time, creatures will be able to block that turn, even if you gain control of more artifacts later in the turn.
6/1/2011 : If the player is an illegal target when Concussive Bolt resolves, the spell will be countered. None of its effects will happen, even if you control three or more artifacts.
6/1/2011 : If you controlled three or more artifacts as Concussive Bolt resolved, the targeted player won't be able to block with any creatures this turn. That is, the set of affected creatures isn't locked in as the spell resolves.

card.name: Consecrated Sphinx
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever an opponent draws a card, you may draw two cards.
card.flavor: Blessed by the hands of Jin-Gitaxias.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : You may either draw two cards or not draw at all. You can't choose to draw only one card.
6/1/2011 : The ability triggers once for each card an opponent draws. You choose whether to draw two cards as each of those abilities resolves.
6/1/2011 : If each player controls a Consecrated Sphinx, their abilities will cause each other to trigger until one player chooses not to draw cards.

card.name: Contested War Zone
card.ability:
Whenever a creature deals combat damage to you, that creature's controller gains control of Contested War Zone.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : The last activated ability affects all attacking creatures, not just those you control.
6/1/2011 : The word "you" in a permanent's trigger condition always refers to the permanent's current controller.
6/1/2011 : Gaining control of Contested War Zone doesn't cause it to tap or untap.
6/1/2011 : In some multiplayer formats, creatures controlled by different players may deal combat damage to you simultaneously. If this happens, you control each triggered ability and can put them on the stack in any order. The last ability to resolve will determine who ends up controlling Contested War Zone.

card.name: Copper Carapace
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
card.flavor:
"We will fight as they do: our flesh protected behind metal."
—Tae Aquil, Viridan weaponsmith

card.name: Core Prowler
card.ability:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
When Core Prowler dies, proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

card.name: Corrupted Conscience
card.ability:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
card.flavor: Karn's creation is now his master.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : Multiple instances of infect on the same creature are redundant.

card.name: Creeping Corrosion
card.ability: Destroy all artifacts.
card.flavor:
"We will reveal the futility of their heresy by showing them how fragile their relics are."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

card.name: Crush
card.ability: Destroy target noncreature artifact.
card.flavor: A golem's hands know no tenderness.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If the targeted artifact is also a creature when Crush tries to resolve, it will be countered.

card.name: Cryptoplasm
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Cryptoplasm become a copy of another target creature. If you do, Cryptoplasm gains this ability.
card.flavor:
"If left in the enemy's shape too long, it might be lost to them."
—Vy Covalt, Neurok agent
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : You choose the target for the triggered ability when the ability is put onto the stack. You choose whether or not Cryptoplasm becomes a copy of that creature when the ability resolves.
6/1/2011 : The copy effect lasts indefinitely. Often, it will last until it is overwritten by another copy effect (if it copies another creature on a future turn, perhaps.)
6/1/2011 : If the creature is an illegal target when the ability tries to resolve, it will be countered. Cryptoplasm won't become a copy of that creature; it remains whatever it was before.
6/1/2011 : If another creature becomes a copy of Cryptoplasm, it will become a copy of whatever Cryptoplasm is currently copying (if anything), plus it will have Cryptoplasm's triggered ability.

card.name: Darksteel Plate
card.ability:
Darksteel Plate is indestructible.
Equipped creature is indestructible.
Equip {2}
card.flavor:
"If there can be no victory, then I will fight forever."
—Koth of the Hammer

card.name: Decimator Web
card.ability: {4}, {T}: Target opponent loses 2 life, gets a poison counter, then puts the top six cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: Mycosynth grew unfettered beneath the black lacuna, metastasizing into a matrix of noxious energy.

card.name: Distant Memories
card.ability: Search your library for a card, exile it, then shuffle your library. Any opponent may have you put that card into your hand. If no player does, you draw three cards.
card.flavor:
"The fleeting shadows of his primitive self have all but vanished."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : The card is exiled face up. Each opponent will know what the card is when deciding whether to have you put it in your hand.
6/1/2011 : If no opponent has you put the card into your hand, the card remains exiled.
6/1/2011 : In multiplayer formats, your opponents each make the decision in turn order.

card.name: Divine Offering
card.ability: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
card.flavor:
"The Phyrexians are vulnerable. Do not despair. We will prevail!"
—Juryan, rebel leader
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, you do not gain any life.
6/1/2011 : If Divine Offering resolves, but the artifact regenerates or is indestructible, you'll still gain the life.

card.name: Dross Ripper
card.ability: {2}{B}: Dross Ripper gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Such a creation serves no purpose other than exterminating every one of us."
—Sadra Alic, Neurok strategist

card.name: Fangren Marauder
card.ability: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may gain 5 life.
card.flavor:
"The fangren fight without comfort of any kind. We can ask no less of ourselves."
—Tilien, Sylvok partisan
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If Fangren Marauder has itself become an artifact for some reason, you'll gain 5 life when it is put into a graveyard from the battlefield.

card.name: Flayer Husk
card.ability:
Living weapon (When this Equipment enters the battlefield, put a 0/0 black Germ creature token onto the battlefield, then attach this to it.)
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
Equip {2}

card.name: Flensermite
card.ability:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

card.name: Flesh-Eater Imp
card.ability:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Sacrifice a creature: Flesh-Eater Imp gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Frantic Salvage
card.ability:
Put any number of target artifact cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: "We will mourn when there is time. For now, we survive."
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : You choose the order of the cards you put on top of your library.
6/1/2011 : You can cast this with zero targets. If you do, you'll get to draw a card. However, if you cast this with at least one target and all of those targets become illegal (because another effect has removed them from the graveyard, perhaps), the spell will be countered and you won't get to draw a card.

card.name: Fuel for the Cause
card.ability: Counter target spell, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
card.flavor: "Your ideas will be discarded and your will repurposed."
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : You must be able to target another spell in order to cast Fuel for the Cause. You can't just cast it in order to proliferate, and it can't target itself.
6/1/2011 : If the spell is an illegal target when Fuel for the Cause tries to resolve, it will be countered. You won't proliferate.

card.name: Galvanoth
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it's an instant or sorcery card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.
card.flavor: It chews open Mirrodin's husk and feeds on the outpouring of energy.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : If the card you look at isn't an instant or sorcery card, it remains on top of your library. You don't reveal it.
6/1/2011 : You may pay additional costs, such as kicker costs, of the instant or sorcery card.
6/1/2011 : If the card has any mandatory additional costs, as Kuldotha Rebirth does, you must pay them in order to cast the spell.
6/1/2011 : If the card has an X in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as its value.

card.name: Glissa, the Traitor
card.ability:
First strike, deathtouch
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If an artifact you own and a creature an opponent controls go to the graveyard at the same time, you may choose that artifact card as the target of Glissa, the Traitor's ability (even if they're the same card: an artifact creature you own that an opponent controlled).

card.name: Glissa's Courier
card.ability: Mountainwalk
card.flavor:
"So, the survivors from Oxid Ridge are on the move. Let them come and witness predation in its purest form."
—Glissa

card.name: Gnathosaur
card.ability: Sacrifice an artifact: Gnathosaur gains trample until end of turn.
card.flavor: Mirran creatures that could withstand the Phyrexian oil found an abundance of crunchy snacks.

card.name: Go for the Throat
card.ability: Destroy target nonartifact creature.
card.flavor: Having flesh is increasingly a liability on Mirrodin.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If the targeted creature is also an artifact when Go for the Throat tries to resolve, it will be countered.

card.name: Goblin Wardriver
card.ability: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
card.flavor:
"A true warrior fights with whatever's handy."
—Qerk of the Secret Warren

card.name: Gore Vassal
card.ability: Sacrifice Gore Vassal: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. Then if that creature's toughness is 1 or greater, regenerate it.
card.flavor:
"Rid them of their unfaithful organs. Bring new hearts to the unbelievers."
—Tome of Machines, verse 1703
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : You can activate Gore Vassal's ability targeting itself, but it won't get a -1/-1 counter or regenerate because it'll be an illegal target when the ability resolves.
6/1/2011 : The regeneration shield will last until the turn ends or until it's used.
6/1/2011 : Let's say you activate Gore Vassal's ability targeting a creature with 3 toughness and 2 damage marked on it. The regeneration shield will be created just before the creature is destroyed for having damage marked on it equal to or greater than its toughness. The creature will then regenerate. That is, all damage will be removed from it and it will become tapped; any counters on the creature, including the -1/-1 counter put on by this ability, remain.

card.name: Green Sun's Zenith
card.ability: Search your library for a green creature card with converted mana cost X or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. Shuffle Green Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
card.flavor: As the green sun crowned, Phyrexian prophecies glowed on the Tree of Tales.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : If this spell is countered, none of its effects occur. In particular, it will go to the graveyard rather than to its owner's library.
6/1/2011 : In most cases, if you own Green Sun's Zenith and cast it, you'll shuffle your library twice. In practice, shuffling once is sufficient, but effects that care about you shuffling your library (like Psychogenic Probe, for example) will see that you've shuffled twice.
6/1/2011 : If you own Green Sun's Zenith, but an opponent casts it (due to Knowledge Pool's effect, for example), that opponent searches his or her library for an appropriate creature card, then shuffles his or her library. That opponent then shuffles Green Sun's Zenith into your library. You won't shuffle any library in this case.

card.name: Gruesome Encore
card.ability: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step. If that creature would leave the battlefield, exile it instead of putting it anywhere else.

card.name: Gust-Skimmer
card.ability: {U}: Gust-Skimmer gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: Phyrexian smog clouds choked the skies, threatening creatures who couldn't comprehend the menace below.

card.name: Hellkite Igniter
card.ability:
Flying, haste
{1}{R}: Hellkite Igniter gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of artifacts you control.
card.flavor: Its flight sets the sky itself on fire.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : The number of artifacts you control is counted when the ability resolves.

card.name: Hero of Bladehold
card.ability:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Hero of Bladehold attacks, put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield tapped and attacking.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : Whenever Hero of Bladehold attacks, both abilities will trigger. You can put them onto the stack in any order. If the token-creating ability resolves first, the tokens each get +1/+0 until end of turn from the battle cry ability.
6/1/2011 : You choose which opponent or planeswalker an opponent controls that each token is attacking when it is put onto the battlefield.
6/1/2011 : Although the tokens are attacking, they never were declared as attacking creatures (for purposes of abilities that trigger whenever a creature attacks, for example).

card.name: Hero of Oxid Ridge
card.ability:
Haste
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Hero of Oxid Ridge attacks, creatures with power 1 or less can't block this turn.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : The power of each creature is checked only when blocking creatures are declared. If a creature has power 1 or less at that time, it can't block, even if its power was greater than 1 when the last ability resolved.
6/1/2011 : Creatures with power 1 or less can't block even if they weren't on the battlefield when the last ability resolved.

card.name: Hexplate Golem
card.flavor:
"Use everything. Iron, rust, scrap . . .even the ground must join our cause."
—Ezuri, renegade leader

card.name: Horrifying Revelation
card.ability: Target player discards a card, then puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor:
"Ours is a glorious transmission! Behold a future where all bow to the Father of Machines."
—Isila, Priest of Sheoldred
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If the player has no cards in his or her hand or no cards in his or her library, the other effect still happens.

card.name: Ichor Wellspring
card.ability: When Ichor Wellspring enters the battlefield or is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Our glorious infection has taken hold."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : The ability will trigger when Ichor Wellspring is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, even if the ability that triggered when it entered the battlefield hasn't resolved yet.

card.name: Inkmoth Nexus
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}: Inkmoth Nexus becomes a 1/1 Blinkmoth artifact creature with flying and infect until end of turn. It's still a land. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : If Inkmoth Nexus entered the battlefield this turn and it's not a creature, it can be tapped for mana. If it becomes a creature that turn, it can't attack or be tapped for mana.
6/1/2011 : If you've controlled Inkmoth Nexus continuously since your most recent turn began and it becomes a creature, it can attack or be tapped for mana.

card.name: Into the Core
card.ability: Exile two target artifacts.
card.flavor:
"They believe they're driving us back, but we're leading them to their doom."
—Kethek, furnace stoker
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : You must be able to target two different artifacts in order to cast Into the Core.

card.name: Kemba's Legion
card.ability:
Vigilance
Kemba's Legion can block an additional creature for each Equipment attached to Kemba's Legion.
card.flavor: The squabble over succession was quickly replaced by the struggle to survive.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : The number of creatures Kemba's Legion can block is calculated when blocking creatures are declared. Take into account the number of Equipment attached to Kemba's Legion at that time, as well as any other effects that increase the number of creatures Kemba's Legion can block.

card.name: Knowledge Pool
card.ability:
Imprint — When Knowledge Pool enters the battlefield, each player exiles the top three cards of his or her library.
Whenever a player casts a spell from his or her hand, that player exiles it. If the player does, he or she may cast another nonland card exiled with Knowledge Pool without paying that card's mana cost.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : You may cast any other card exiled by Knowledge Pool, including one owned by an opponent. Any card exiled by Knowledge Pool’s enters-the-battlefield ability or its other triggered ability may be cast.
6/1/2011 : The spell a player casts from his or her hand won't resolve if it's exiled, even if that spell can't be countered by spells or abilities.
6/1/2011 : If the original spell isn't exiled (perhaps because it's countered by another spell or ability before Knowledge Pool's second triggered ability resolves), the rest of the ability does nothing. The player doesn't get to cast an exiled card.
6/1/2011 : If there are no nonland cards exiled by Knowledge Pool, the original spell is still exiled.
6/1/2011 : You may pay additional costs, such as kicker costs, of the exiled card.
6/1/2011 : If the card has any mandatory additional costs, as Kuldotha Rebirth does, you must pay them in order to cast the spell.
6/1/2011 : Timing restrictions based on the card's type are ignored. For example, you can cast an exiled creature card this way. Other restrictions, such as Spinal Embrace's "Cast Spinal Embrace only during combat" are not ignored.
6/1/2011 : If the card you cast without paying its mana cost has an X in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as its value.
6/1/2011 : Any other abilities that trigger when you cast the original spell (for example, if you cast Emrakul, the Aeons Torn) will still trigger and go on the stack.
6/1/2011 : If multiple Knowledge Pools are on the battlefield, keep track of which cards are exiled by each of them. Whenever a player casts a spell from his or her hand: -- If all Knowledge Pools are controlled by the same player, that player chooses the order in which the triggered abilities are put onto the stack. The last one put onto the stack will be the first to resolve. -- If multiple players each control one or more Knowledge Pools, the active player put his or her triggered abilities on the stack in any order, then each other player in turn order does the same. The last ability put onto the stack this way will be the first to resolve. -- The first triggered ability to resolve will exile the original spell, then the player who cast that spell may cast one of the nonland cards exiled by the Knowledge Pool that generated that triggered ability. The abilities of other Knowledge Pools will do nothing when they resolve, as the original spell will already have been exiled.

card.name: Koth's Courier
card.ability: Forestwalk
card.flavor: Koth sent partisans into the Tangle to bring survivors to the safe haven of the tunnels below Kuldotha.

card.name: Kuldotha Flamefiend
card.ability: When Kuldotha Flamefiend enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you do, Kuldotha Flamefiend deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : Kuldotha Flamefiend's ability may target up to four creatures and/or players. Each must be chosen to receive at least 1 damage.
6/1/2011 : You choose the target(s) and how the damage will be divided when you put the triggered ability on the stack. You don't choose whether to sacrifice an artifact or which artifact you're sacrificing until the ability resolves. Once you decide to sacrifice an artifact (or not), it's too late for players to respond.

card.name: Kuldotha Ringleader
card.ability:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Kuldotha Ringleader attacks each turn if able.
card.flavor: Being surrounded by goblins is less objectionable when they're fighting for you.

card.name: Lead the Stampede
card.ability: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal any number of creature cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

card.name: Leonin Relic-Warder
card.ability:
When Leonin Relic-Warder enters the battlefield, you may exile target artifact or enchantment.
When Leonin Relic-Warder leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If Leonin Relic-Warder leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and when it resolves, do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted artifact or enchantment with no way to return it to the battlefield.

card.name: Leonin Skyhunter
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: "The infection has spread farther than we could glimpse from the heights of Taj-Nar."

card.name: Loxodon Partisan
card.ability: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
card.flavor: "This war is not about loxodon or leonin, Sylvok or Auriok. To defeat these rotters, we must do it together."

card.name: Lumengrid Gargoyle
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor:
"Anything that watches without sleep and fights without fear is a valuable ally against the Phyrexians."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent

card.name: Magnetic Mine
card.ability: Whenever another artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Magnetic Mine deals 2 damage to that artifact's controller.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : Magnetic Mine will not trigger when it is put into a graveyard from the battlefield itself, although it will trigger if another artifact is put into the graveyard from the battlefield at the same time.

card.name: Massacre Wurm
card.ability:
When Massacre Wurm enters the battlefield, creatures your opponents control get -2/-2 until end of turn.
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, that player loses 2 life.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : If an opponent controls a creature you own, that opponent will lose 2 life when that creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield.
6/1/2011 : If a creature an opponent controls is put into the graveyard from the battlefield at the same time as Massacre Wurm, its last ability will trigger.

card.name: Master's Call
card.ability: Put two 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: The need to obey was inscribed on every plate in their bodies.

card.name: Melira's Keepers
card.ability: Melira's Keepers can't have counters placed on it.
card.flavor: Her warriors are the last defense against the coming storm.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : Melira's Keepers can't have any kind of counters placed on it, not just -1/-1 counters.
6/1/2011 : Damage from a source with infect has no effect on Melira's Keepers. No -1/-1 counters are placed on it, and no damage is marked on it. The damage is still dealt for purposes of effects that care about damage, such as lifelink.
6/1/2011 : If Melira's Keepers would enter the battlefield with a counter on it, it simply enters the battlefield without that counter.
6/1/2011 : If a creature with a counter on it becomes a copy of Melira's Keepers, those counters will remain.

card.name: Metallic Mastery
card.ability: Gain control of target artifact until end of turn. Untap that artifact. It gains haste until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"All will be reforged in the fires of glory."
—Urabrask the Hidden

card.name: Mirran Crusader
card.ability: Double strike, protection from black and from green
card.flavor: A symbol of what Mirrodin once was and hope for what it will be again.

card.name: Mirran Mettle
card.ability:
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Metalcraft — That creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn instead if you control three or more artifacts.
card.flavor: "Our land will not yield to Phyrexian corruption!"

card.name: Mirran Spy
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may untap target creature.
card.flavor: Accurate information is a precious commodity in times of war.

card.name: Mirrorworks
card.ability: Whenever another nontoken artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {2}. If you do, put a token that's a copy of that artifact onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: The faces of Geth's corpse-dredgers are disturbingly similar.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : Each time the ability triggers, you can pay {2} only one time to get one token.
6/1/2011 : As the token is created, it checks the printed values of the artifact it's copying, as well as any copy effects that have been applied to it.
6/1/2011 : The copiable values of the token's characteristics are the same as the copiable values of the characteristics of the artifact it's copying.
6/1/2011 : If the artifact that caused Mirrorworks's ability to trigger has already left the battlefield by the time the ability resolves, you can still pay {2}. If you do, you'll still put a token onto the battlefield. That token has the copiable values of the characteristics of that nontoken artifact as it last existed on the battlefield.

card.name: Mitotic Manipulation
card.ability: Look at the top seven cards of your library. You may put one of those cards onto the battlefield if it has the same name as a permanent. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.flavor:
"They can't even comprehend nature. How could they improve it?"
—Venser
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : "The same name as a permanent" means the same name as a permanent currently on the battlefield as Mitotic Manipulation resolves.
6/1/2011 : No matter how many of the seven cards have the same name as a permanent, you can put only one of them onto the battlefield.
6/1/2011 : You don't reveal any of the other cards or the order in which they go to the bottom of your library.

card.name: Morbid Plunder
card.ability: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Even the dead are raw materials for the Phyrexian vision of perfection.

card.name: Mortarpod
card.ability:
Living weapon (When this Equipment enters the battlefield, put a 0/0 black Germ creature token onto the battlefield, then attach this to it.)
Equipped creature gets +0/+1 and has "Sacrifice this creature: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
Equip {2}
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If you sacrifice the equipped creature to deal 1 damage to a target creature or player, the damage is dealt by the creature as it last existed on the battlefield.

card.name: Myr Sire
card.ability: When Myr Sire dies, put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: For the Phyrexians, death is not an end, nor a one-time occurrence.

card.name: Myr Turbine
card.ability:
{T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
{T}, Tap five untapped Myr you control: Search your library for a Myr creature card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : You can tap a Myr that hasn't been under your control since your most recent turn began to pay for the cost of the second activated ability.

card.name: Myr Welder
card.ability:
Imprint — {T}: Exile target artifact card from a graveyard.
Myr Welder has all activated abilities of all cards exiled with it.
card.flavor: Memnarch designed some myr to follow the levelers and reaffix lost parts. Mirran partisans put that instinct to good use.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : Myr Welder has only the activated abilities of cards it exiles. It doesn't gain triggered abilities or static abilities.
6/1/2011 : Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities; they have colons in their reminder text.
6/1/2011 : If an activated ability of a card exiled with Myr Welder references the card it's printed on by name, treat Myr Welder's version of that ability as though it referenced Myr Welder by name instead. For example, if Lux Cannon (which says, in part, "{T}: Put a charge counter on Lux Cannon.") has been exiled by Myr Welder, Myr Welder has the ability "{T}: Put a charge counter on Myr Welder."

card.name: Nested Ghoul
card.ability: Whenever a source deals damage to Nested Ghoul, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"The chest cavity is cleared of useless meat. I know just what to do with the space."
—Gyed, Vault Priest
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : If multiple sources deal damage to Nested Ghoul simultaneously (because it was blocked by multiple creatures, for example), the ability will trigger for each source dealing damage to Nested Ghoul.
6/1/2011 : Nested Ghoul's ability will trigger if a source with infect deals damage to it.

card.name: Neurok Commando
card.ability:
Shroud
Whenever Neurok Commando deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: "There's no more time for secluded study. Answers are there only for those with the courage to take them."
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : Only one card is drawn no matter how much combat damage was dealt.

card.name: Oculus
card.ability: When Oculus dies, you may draw a card.
card.flavor:
"In its gaze I saw no mercy, no recognition that I was worthy to exist."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent

card.name: Ogre Resister
card.flavor: He didn't have a word for "home," but he knew it was something to be defended.

card.name: Peace Strider
card.ability: When Peace Strider enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
card.flavor:
"The Vanished must have sent it from beyond to aid us in this struggle."
—Kessla, Sylvok shaman

card.name: Phyresis
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
card.flavor:
"Perfection is at hand. You have been freed of weakness and made compleat."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : Multiple instances of infect on the same creature are redundant.

card.name: Phyrexian Crusader
card.ability:
First strike, protection from red and from white
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If Phyrexian Crusader blocks or is blocked by a creature without first strike or double strike, the damage dealt by Phyrexian Crusader results in -1/-1 counters that will affect how much damage the other creature assigns (if it's still on the battlefield).

card.name: Phyrexian Digester
card.ability: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
card.flavor:
"Our cause will ripen in the fertile flesh of the unworthy."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

card.name: Phyrexian Hydra
card.ability:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
If damage would be dealt to Phyrexian Hydra, prevent that damage. Put a -1/-1 counter on Phyrexian Hydra for each 1 damage prevented this way.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : If multiple damage prevention effects, including Phyrexian Hydra's, are attempting to prevent damage that would be dealt to Phyrexian Hydra, its controller chooses which to apply.
6/1/2011 : If damage dealt to Phyrexian Hydra can't be prevented (due to Leyline of Punishment, for example), it will be dealt as normal and won't cause Phyrexian Hydra to put -1/-1 counters to be put on itself.

card.name: Phyrexian Juggernaut
card.ability:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Phyrexian Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
card.flavor: Where nature impedes, Phyrexians overcome.

card.name: Phyrexian Rager
card.ability: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
card.flavor:
"I believe many worlds will bow to Phyrexia. Mirrodin is merely the first."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

card.name: Phyrexian Rebirth
card.ability: Destroy all creatures, then put an X/X colorless Horror artifact creature token onto the battlefield, where X is the number of creatures destroyed this way.
card.flavor: As long as one drop of the oil exists, the joyous work continues.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : If a creature regenerates or is indestructible, it won't be counted when determining the value of X.
6/1/2011 : Any triggered abilities that trigger because a creature was destroyed won't be put onto the stack until after Phyrexian Rebirth finishes resolving. This means the Horror creature token can be targeted by those abilities, if applicable.

card.name: Phyrexian Revoker
card.ability:
As Phyrexian Revoker enters the battlefield, name a nonland card.
Activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can't be activated.
card.flavor: Basic senses like sight and taste are reserved for those in power.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities; they have colons in their reminder text.
6/1/2011 : Triggered abilities and static abilities of sources with the chosen name are unaffected.
6/1/2011 : Phyrexian Revoker's ability affects sources with the chosen name no matter what zone they are in. For example, if Reassembling Skeleton is the chosen name, you can't activate its ability that returns it from the graveyard to the battlefield.
4/15/2013 : If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters the battlefield trigger on the stack in either order.

card.name: Phyrexian Vatmother
card.ability:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you get a poison counter.

card.name: Pierce Strider
card.ability: When Pierce Strider enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 3 life.
card.flavor:
"Pain isn't a negative stimulus. Pain is a sign of your imperfection."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

card.name: Piston Sledge
card.ability:
When Piston Sledge enters the battlefield, attach it to target creature you control.
Equipped creature gets +3/+1.
Equip—Sacrifice an artifact.
card.flavor: Only the goblins could make a simple machine so complex.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : If there are no creatures on the battlefield that Piston Sledge could be attached to when its enters-the-battlefield triggered ability resolves, it remains on the battlefield unattached.
6/1/2011 : You can sacrifice Piston Sledge to pay its own equip cost. It won't become attached as it will be in your graveyard.

card.name: Pistus Strike
card.ability: Destroy target creature with flying. Its controller gets a poison counter.
card.flavor:
"Even a nuisance such as the pistus fly has a purpose in our new world."
—Glissa
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : If the creature is an illegal target when Pistus Strike tries to resolve, the spell is countered. No player gets a poison counter.
6/1/2011 : If the creature with flying regenerates or is indestructible, its controller will still get a poison counter.

card.name: Plague Myr
card.ability:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: They watch for a new master, one more sinister than the last.

card.name: Plaguemaw Beast
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
card.flavor: Phyrexia's spiral of consumption grows ever wider and darker.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : You can sacrifice Plaguemaw Beast to pay the cost of its own activated ability.
6/1/2011 : You can activate the ability even if there are no players or permanents with counters on them.

card.name: Praetor's Counsel
card.ability: Return all cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Praetor's Counsel. You have no maximum hand size for the rest of the game.
card.flavor: As the Phyrexian contagion corroded Karn's body, the praetors whispered psalms to corrupt his mind.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then resolve Praetor's Counsel, you have no maximum hand size. However, if those events happened in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.
6/1/2011 : Later effects that modify your maximum hand size, but don't set it to a specific number, will have no effect.

card.name: Priests of Norn
card.ability:
Vigilance
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
card.flavor:
"May our blessings sever the tongues of the forsaken."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

card.name: Psychosis Crawler
card.ability:
Psychosis Crawler's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
Whenever you draw a card, each opponent loses 1 life.
card.flavor:
"If that brain can't figure out the secret of the serum, then add more brains."
—Rhmir, Hand of the Augur
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If an effect causes you to draw multiple cards, Psychosis Crawler will trigger that many times.

card.name: Quicksilver Geyser
card.ability: Return up to two target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.
card.flavor:
"Phyrexians are tenacious. That's not the same thing as clever."
—Tezzeret

card.name: Quilled Slagwurm
card.flavor: Vorinclex removed its teeth so it wouldn't waste time chewing before moving to the next kill.

card.name: Rally the Forces
card.ability: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Drive them back! Make their underworld into their grave!"
—Koth of the Hammer
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : Even though Rally the Forces affects only attacking creatures, the bonus will remain for the rest of the turn.
6/1/2011 : If Rally the Forces is cast before attackers are declared or after combat ends, it won't do anything.

card.name: Razorfield Rhino
card.ability: Metalcraft — Razorfield Rhino gets +2/+2 as long as you control three or more artifacts.
card.flavor: Adapted to tread on razorgrass, the rhino proved adept at treading on Phyrexians as well.

card.name: Red Sun's Zenith
card.ability: Red Sun's Zenith deals X damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead. Shuffle Red Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If this spell is countered, none of its effects occur. In particular, it will go to the graveyard rather than to its owner's library.

card.name: Rot Wolf
card.ability:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Rot Wolf this turn dies, you may draw a card.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If Rot Wolf and a creature dealt damage by Rot Wolf go to the graveyard at the same time, Rot Wolf's ability will trigger.

card.name: Rusted Slasher
card.ability: Sacrifice an artifact: Regenerate Rusted Slasher.
card.flavor:
"It's a beautiful vision. Discarded debris is reborn as a singular entity."
—Urabrask the Hidden
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : You may sacrifice Rusted Slasher to pay for its own regeneration ability. If you do, however, it won't regenerate. It'll just end up in its owner's graveyard as a result of the sacrifice.

card.name: Sangromancer
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, you may gain 3 life.
Whenever an opponent discards a card, you may gain 3 life.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If one or more creatures an opponent controls are put into the graveyard at the same time as Sangromancer, Sangromancer's first ability will trigger that many times.

card.name: Scourge Servant
card.ability: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
card.flavor:
"The union of the oil and necrogen has produced many pleasing reactions."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

card.name: Septic Rats
card.ability:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Whenever Septic Rats attacks, if defending player is poisoned, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : A player is poisoned if that player has one or more poison counters.
6/1/2011 : Septic Rats gets a maximum of +1/+1 from its ability, no matter how many poison counters the defending player has.

card.name: Serum Raker
card.ability:
Flying
When Serum Raker dies, each player discards a card.
card.flavor: The serum from the blinkmoths they gather greases the joints of witch engines.

card.name: Shimmer Myr
card.ability:
Flash
You may cast artifact cards as though they had flash.
card.flavor: It evades Phyrexians by hiding in the spaces between seconds.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : Because the artifact lands of the original _Mirrodin_(R) block aren't cast, Shimmer Myr's ability doesn't affect them.

card.name: Shriekhorn
card.ability:
Shriekhorn enters the battlefield with three charge counters on it.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Shriekhorn: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

card.name: Signal Pest
card.ability:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Signal Pest can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.
card.flavor: It leaps from tree to tree, revealing the enemy's positions.

card.name: Silverskin Armor
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 and is an artifact in addition to its other types.
Equip {2}
card.flavor: Partisan spies warned that no armor would protect the body from Phyrexian infection. Neurok strategists took that as a challenge.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : The equipped creature will remain whatever color(s) it was previously. Becoming an artifact doesn't make the creature colorless.

card.name: Skinwing
card.ability:
Living weapon (When this Equipment enters the battlefield, put a 0/0 black Germ creature token onto the battlefield, then attach this to it.)
Equipped creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
Equip {6}

card.name: Slagstorm
card.ability: Choose one — Slagstorm deals 3 damage to each creature; or Slagstorm deals 3 damage to each player.
card.flavor:
"As long as we have the will to fight, we are never without weapons."
—Koth of the Hammer

card.name: Sphere of the Suns
card.ability:
Sphere of the Suns enters the battlefield tapped and with three charge counters on it.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Sphere of the Suns: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Spin Engine
card.ability: {R}: Target creature can't block Spin Engine this turn.
card.flavor:
"It will be battle-ready before our strike at Oxid Ridge, and it will guarantee our victory."
—Ketuc of the Helm

card.name: Spine of Ish Sah
card.ability:
When Spine of Ish Sah enters the battlefield, destroy target permanent.
When Spine of Ish Sah is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Spine of Ish Sah to its owner's hand.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : Spine of Ish Sah's last ability doesn't allow you to sacrifice it. You must find another way to get Spine of Ish Sah into the graveyard.

card.name: Spiraling Duelist
card.ability: Metalcraft — Spiraling Duelist has double strike as long as you control three or more artifacts.
card.flavor: "I never move the same way twice. Those rotters can't grasp chaos."
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If Spiraling Duelist has double strike as the combat damage step begins, there will be a second combat damage step. As that second combat damage step begins, if Spiraling Duelist no longer has double strike (perhaps because an artifact creature you controlled was destroyed), Spiraling Duelist will not assign combat damage a second time.

card.name: Spire Serpent
card.ability:
Defender
Metalcraft — As long as you control three or more artifacts, Spire Serpent gets +2/+2 and can attack as though it didn't have defender.
card.flavor: A mirror to draw its eye, a rod to rouse its rage, and a sword to break its bonds.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : Spire Serpent still has defender if you control three or more artifacts, although it will be able to attack.
6/1/2011 : If Spire Serpent has been declared as an attacker, and you stop controlling three or more artifacts later in combat, Spire Serpent continues being an attacking creature until combat ends.

card.name: Spread the Sickness
card.ability: Destroy target creature, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
card.flavor: Life is ephemeral. Phyrexia is eternal.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : If the creature is an illegal target when Spread the Sickness tries to resolve, the spell is countered. You won't proliferate.
6/1/2011 : If the creature regenerates or is indestructible when Spread the Sickness resolves, you'll still proliferate.

card.name: Steel Sabotage
card.ability: Choose one — Counter target artifact spell; or return target artifact to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"You are hopelessly obsolete, my brothers. Come and join the Great Work."
—Rhmir, Hand of the Augur
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : An artifact spell exists only on the stack. An artifact exists only on the battlefield.

card.name: Strandwalker
card.ability:
Living weapon (When this Equipment enters the battlefield, put a 0/0 black Germ creature token onto the battlefield, then attach this to it.)
Equipped creature gets +2/+4 and has reach.
Equip {4}

card.name: Sword of Feast and Famine
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2 and has protection from black and from green.
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card and you untap all lands you control.
Equip {2}
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : You'll untap all lands you control even if the player doesn't discard a card.

card.name: Tangle Hulk
card.ability: {2}{G}: Regenerate Tangle Hulk.
card.flavor:
"A true Phyrexian predator. It will never know death, just as nature intended."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

card.name: Tangle Mantis
card.ability: Trample
card.flavor: The fiercest hunters in the Tangle don't seek out the mantises. They are the mantises.

card.name: Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas
card.ability:
+1: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal an artifact card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
-1: Target artifact becomes a 5/5 artifact creature.
-4: Target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is twice the number of artifacts you control.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : The artifact targeted by the second ability will retain any types, subtypes, or supertypes it has. Notably, if an Equipment becomes an artifact creature, it can't be attached to another creature. If it was attached to a creature, it becomes unattached.
6/1/2011 : If the target of the second ability is already an artifact creature, its power and toughness will each become 5. This overwrites all previous effects that set the creature's power and toughness to specific values. Any power- or toughness-setting effects that start to apply after this ability resolves will overwrite this effect.
6/1/2011 : Effects that modify that creature's power or toughness, such as the effects of Giant Growth, will apply to it no matter when they started to take effect. The same is true for counters that change the creature's power or toughness (such as -1/-1 counters) and effects that switch its power and toughness.
6/1/2011 : The number of artifacts you control is counted when the last ability resolves, not when it is activated.

card.name: Thopter Assembly
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control no Thopters other than Thopter Assembly, return Thopter Assembly to its owner's hand and put five 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : The triggered ability looks for any permanent you control with the creature type Thopter, not just the Thopter tokens previously created by a Thopter Assembly.

card.name: Thrun, the Last Troll
card.ability:
Thrun, the Last Troll can't be countered.
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Thrun.
card.flavor: His crime was silence, and now he suffers it eternally.

card.name: Tine Shrike
card.ability:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
card.flavor: A new bird of prey—one that hunts sentience.

card.name: Titan Forge
card.ability:
{3}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Titan Forge.
{T}, Remove three charge counters from Titan Forge: Put a 9/9 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Training Drone
card.ability: Training Drone can't attack or block unless it's equipped.
card.flavor:
"Vulshok flail, Viridian shield, loxodon blade . . . Tazzir, bring the Moriok hook and assemble the rookies."
—Vy Covalt, Neurok agent
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If Training Drone has been declared as an attacking or blocking creature, and it stops being equipped later in combat, it won't stop attacking or blocking.

card.name: Treasure Mage
card.ability: When Treasure Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If a card in your library has X in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.

card.name: Turn the Tide
card.ability: Creatures your opponents control get -2/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Let their mindless armies come and face the might of genius."
—Varil, Neurok partisan
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : Only creatures your opponents control when Turn the Tide resolves are affected. Creatures that enter the battlefield later in the turn are not.

card.name: Unnatural Predation
card.ability: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Domination by the strongest—that is all that matters in the Tangle now."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

card.name: Vedalken Anatomist
card.ability: {2}{U}, {T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. You may tap or untap that creature.
card.flavor: "Specimen 211 examination report. Observation: graft sublimation incomplete. Result: death. Prepare specimen 212."
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If the creature is an illegal target when the ability tries to resolve, it will be countered. None of its effects happen.

card.name: Vedalken Infuser
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on target artifact.
card.flavor: "All plans begin as dreams. I intend to awaken them."
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : You may target and put a charge counter on any artifact, even if it doesn't have an ability that references charge counters.

card.name: Victory's Herald
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Victory's Herald attacks, attacking creatures gain flying and lifelink until end of turn.
card.flavor: The corruption stirred the heavens above, awaking a shining champion.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : Even though the triggered ability affects only attacking creatures, the bonuses will remain for the rest of the turn.
6/1/2011 : Victory's Herald also gains flying (which will likely be redundant) and lifelink if it's still attacking when the ability resolves.

card.name: Viridian Claw
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
Equip {1}
card.flavor: "Phyrexians can't corrupt what they can't get close enough to touch."

card.name: Viridian Corrupter
card.ability:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
When Viridian Corrupter enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
card.ruling:
6/1/2011 : If there are no artifacts on the battlefield when Viridian Corrupter enters the battlefield, its enters-the-battlefield does nothing. Viridian Corrupter will simply enter the battlefield.
6/1/2011 : The enters-the-battlefield ability is not optional. You must target an artifact you control if there are no other artifacts on the battlefield.

card.name: Viridian Emissary
card.ability: When Viridian Emissary dies, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Virulent Wound
card.ability: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. When that creature dies this turn, its controller gets a poison counter.
card.flavor: Sadly, the extent of Gerkk's healing knowledge was "don't pick at it."
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If the creature is not put into a graveyard on the turn Virulent Wound resolves, its controller won't get a poison counter.

card.name: Vivisection
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Vivisection, sacrifice a creature.
Draw three cards.
card.flavor: Phyrexians research with the grace of surgeons and the finesse of butchers.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: White Sun's Zenith
card.ability: Put X 2/2 white Cat creature tokens onto the battlefield. Shuffle White Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
card.flavor: After the Battle of Liet Field, the white sun crested above Taj-Nar, bringing hope to all who survived the carnage.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011 : If this spell is countered, none of its effects occur. In particular, it will go to the graveyard rather than to its owner's library.
